methods.create:
This actually performs the operation. It will typically be performed after the

:param request: (GrpcTableOperation.T) - the original request from the user
:param sourceTables: (java.util.List<io.deephaven.grpc_api.session.SessionState.ExportObject<io.deephaven.db.tables.Table>>) - the source tables that this operation may or may not need
:return: (io.deephaven.db.tables.Table) the resulting table
methods.getRequestFromOperation:
Extract the specific request object from the batch operation.

:param op: (io.deephaven.proto.backplane.grpc.BatchTableRequest.Operation) - the batch operation
:return: (GrpcTableOperation.T) the typed request from the batch
methods.getResultTicket:
Get the result ticket for this operation.

:param request: (GrpcTableOperation.T) - the request
:return: (io.deephaven.proto.backplane.grpc.Ticket) the result ticket
methods.getTableReferences:
Get the table references for this operation.

:param request: (GrpcTableOperation.T) - the request
:return: (java.util.List<io.deephaven.proto.backplane.grpc.TableReference>) the table references of the other source table dependencies
methods.validateRequest:
This method validates preconditions of the request.

:param request: (GrpcTableOperation.T) - the original request from the user
